> -----Original Message-----
> From: Craig Dickson [mailto:craigsdickson@...] 
> 
> I would definately be interested in an extension to
> the JUnit batchtest task in Ant that could gather the
> tests that had been compiled in the last "x" minutes,
> or even better gather the tests that relate to classes
> (perhaps via naming patterns) that have been compiled
> in the last "x" minutes.

This might be do-able in Ant with a combo of <uptodate/> task and the
<junit><batchtest/> task.  The JUnit target would depend on an
<uptodate> target, which sets a "tests.noChange" property based on the
status of a bunch of <srcfiles>, letting the JUnit tests run
unless="tests.noChange".

This would make Ant only run JUnit on tests or classes (depending how
you set up the <srcfiles>, how you name your test cases, and what
<mapper> you use) that weren't up-to-date.

Another way to make tests run faster might be to put a <parallel> task
around your <junit> task.

Scott Stirling
